translator

Class CypherTranslator

  • java.lang.Object
    • translator.CypherTranslator

  • class CypherTranslator
extends java.lang.Object
    Main class for translating the Cypher input to its internal representation. The representation includes extracting the nodes and relationships, finding out what needs to be returned, seeing if they have any important constraints etc. A DecodedQuery object is returned containing all the relevant information for the SQL generation module.

    • Method Detail

      • generateDecodedQuery

        static DecodedQuery generateDecodedQuery(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> tokenList,
                                         CypherWalker cypWalker)
                                  throws java.lang.Exception
        Creates a DecodedQuery object for the Cypher input.
        Parameters:
        tokenList - Token list generated from the ANTLR framework.
        cypWalker - CypherWalker object containing additional info about the Cypher input.
        Returns:
        DecodedQuery object representing the Cypher input.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Failed to generate a valid DecodedObject for the Cypher input.

      • generateDQCreateDelete

        private static DecodedQuery generateDQCreateDelete(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> tokenList,
                                                   CypherWalker cypWalker,
                                                   int posOfMatch,
                                                   int posOfWhere)
                                            throws java.lang.Exception
        Generate a DecodedQuery object for Cypher statements with CREATE or DELETE keywords.
        Parameters:
        tokenList - List of tokens in the Cypher query.
        cypWalker - CypherWalker object.
        posOfMatch - Index in token list where MATCH keyword is present (-1 if not).
        posOfWhere - Index in token list where WHERE keyword is present (-1 if not).
        Returns:
        DecodedQuery object with all relevant information.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Failed to generate a valid DecodedObject for the Cypher input.

      • matchDecode

        private static MatchClause matchDecode(java.util.List<java.lang.String> matchClause)
                                throws java.lang.Exception
        Translate MATCH part of the Cypher input.
        Parameters:
        matchClause - The tokens comprising the MATCH clause of Cypher.
        Returns:
        MatchClause object with all the important information inside it.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Error in the clause.

      • extractNodes

        private static java.util.ArrayList<CypNode> extractNodes(java.util.List<java.lang.String> clause,
                                                         MatchClause m)
        Extract nodes from the MATCH clause.
        Parameters:
        clause - Tokens that formed original MATCH part of Cypher.
        m - Needed for the internal ID representation.
        Returns:
        List of internal node objects extracted.

      • extractRels

        private static java.util.ArrayList<CypRel> extractRels(java.util.List<java.lang.String> clause,
                                                       MatchClause m)
                                                throws java.lang.Exception
        Extract the relationships from the MATCH clause.
        Parameters:
        clause - Token version of the clause.
        m - Internal representation of the MATCH clause.
        Returns:
        An ArrayList of CypRel objects that correspond to the relationships (if any) described by Cypher.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Error in the clause.

      • getJSONProps

        private static com.google.gson.JsonObject getJSONProps(java.util.List<java.lang.String> propsString)
        Takes token list of JSON based properties string, and converts this to an actual JSON object.
        Parameters:
        propsString - Token list in form similar to ["{", "key", ":", "value", "}"]
        Returns:
        JSONObject matching the propsString argument.

      • extractIdAndLabels

        private static java.lang.String[] extractIdAndLabels(java.util.List<java.lang.String> tokens)
        Extracts the id and label(s) from a list of tokens. This is returned in a size 2 String array.
        Parameters:
        tokens - Token list being examined for id and label(s).
        Returns:
        String array; [0] containing the id and [1] containing the label(s).

      • extractVarRel

        private static CypRel extractVarRel(java.util.List<java.lang.String> varRel,
                                    int internalID,
                                    java.lang.String varDirection)
        Method to calculate the direction for a variable path length relationship. The # separates the lengths specified for the variable length (the -[*1..9]- part), and the direction of the path (whether it is 'left', 'right', or 'none'. The latter part is defined by the argument varDirection.
        Parameters:
        varRel - The token list describing the variable length path.
        internalID - ID of the relationship in the context of the MatchClause object.
        varDirection - The direction of the path: none, left, or right.
        Returns:
        A CypRel object to be stored.

      • returnDecode

        private static ReturnClause returnDecode(java.util.List<java.lang.String> returnClause,
                                         MatchClause matchC,
                                         CypherWalker cypWalker)
                                  throws java.lang.Exception
        Translate the RETURN part of the Cypher input.
        Parameters:
        returnClause - Token list for the RETURN part of the Cypher input.
        matchC - MatchClause object for the same Cypher input (the MATCH part of the input MUST BE decoded before the RETURN part can be).
        cypWalker - Additional information about the query.
        Returns:
        ReturnClause object
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Error in creating the ReturnClause object (exception thrown in extractReturn method).

      • extractReturn

        private static CypReturn extractReturn(java.util.List<java.lang.String> clause,
                                       MatchClause matchC,
                                       CypherWalker cypWalker)
                                throws java.lang.Exception
        Extracts a CypReturn object from a list of tokens describing an individual component from the RETURN part of the original Cypher input.
        Parameters:
        clause - List of tokens describing the individual return component.
        matchC - MatchClause of same Cypher input.
        cypWalker - CypherWalker object used in the parsing process.
        Returns:
        CypReturn object generated from the list of tokens passed as an argument to this function.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - The tokens presented do not match a possible structure for a return item.

        private static OrderClause orderDecode(java.util.List<java.lang.String> orderClause)
                                throws java.lang.Exception
        Translate the ORDER BY part of the Cypher input (if one is present).
        Parameters:
        orderClause - Tokenised form of the ORDER BY part of the Cypher input.
        Returns:
        OrderClause representing the tokenised input.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Failed to generate a valid OrderClause object.

      • extractOrder

        private static CypOrder extractOrder(java.util.List<java.lang.String> clause)
                              throws java.lang.Exception
        Extracts a CypOrder object from the tokenised input.
        Parameters:
        clause - Token list describing the ORDER BY part of the original Cypher query.
        Returns:
        CypOrder object matching the inputted token list.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - The tokens presented do not match a possible structure for an ORDER BY item.

      • whereDecode

        private static void whereDecode(MatchClause matchC,
                                CypherWalker cypWalker)
                         throws java.lang.Exception
        Generate a WhereClause object from the Cypher input. Where string should be contained within the cypWalker object.
        Parameters:
        matchC - MatchClause object generated from same Cypher input.
        cypWalker - CypherWalker object (contains string for WHERE part of input which is being parsed)
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Error in generating the WhereClause object.

      • addAnyWhere

        private static void addAnyWhere(java.lang.String collection,
                                java.lang.String predicateValue,
                                MatchClause matchC,
                                boolean not,
                                CypWhere cW,
                                java.lang.String typeAny)
                         throws java.lang.Exception
        If the WHERE component contains the keyword ANY, such as in: WHERE any(name in a.name WHERE name IN ['uid', 'postgres']) then this is the method that will be called to convert it into the intermediate representation.
        Parameters:
        collection - The collection value (in the example above, collection would be equal to a.name).
        predicateValue - The list after the keyword IN (['uid', 'postgres']).
        matchC - MatchClause of the Cypher input.
        not - If the NOT keyword is used in this component, this flag is set to true.
        cW - CypWhere object.
        typeAny - Either set to 'in' or '='; in the former case of 'in', this is true when the WHERE component is of the format (any(... IN [...])). In the latter case of 'in', the WHERE component is of the form (any(... = ...)). See a list of the example queries for more info.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - The id does not match any nodes/relationships.

      • addIDWhere

        private static void addIDWhere(java.lang.String[] idAndValue,
                               MatchClause matchC,
                               boolean not,
                               CypWhere cW)
                        throws java.lang.Exception
        If the WHERE component contains the function id(...), such as in: WHERE id(s) = 349 then this is the method that will be called to convert it into the intermediate representation.
        Parameters:
        idAndValue - String array - idAndValue[0] will include the id of the node; idAndValue[1] will contain the logical operator and the value.
        matchC - MatchClause of the Cypher input.
        not - If the NOT keyword is used in this component, this flag is set to true.
        cW - CypWhere object.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - The id does not match any nodes/relationships.

      • addExistsWhere

        private static void addExistsWhere(java.lang.String clause,
                                   MatchClause matchC,
                                   boolean not,
                                   CypWhere cW)
                            throws java.lang.Exception
        If the WHERE component contains the function exists(...), such as in: WHERE exists(n.value) then this is the method that will be called to convert it into the intermediate representation.
        Parameters:
        clause - Contains the string within the exists function (in the example above, this would be 'n.value').
        matchC - MatchClause of the Cypher input.
        not - If the NOT keyword is used in this component, this flag is set to true.
        cW - CypWhere object.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - The id does not match any nodes/relationships.

      • addLabelsWhere

        private static void addLabelsWhere(java.lang.String[] idAndValue,
                                   MatchClause matchC,
                                   boolean not,
                                   CypWhere cW)
                            throws java.lang.Exception
        If the WHERE component contains the function labels(...), such as in: WHERE 'Local' in labels(n) then this is the method that will be called to convert it into the intermediate representation.
        Parameters:
        idAndValue - String array; idAndValue[0] = value being searched for ('Local'), idAndValue[1] = labels(id).
        matchC - MatchClause of the Cypher input.
        not - If the NOT keyword is used in this component, this flag is set to true.
        cW - CypWhere object.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - The id does not match any nodes/relationships.

      • addCondition

        private static void addCondition(java.lang.String[] idAndValue,
                                 MatchClause matchC,
                                 java.lang.String op,
                                 boolean not,
                                 CypWhere cW)
                          throws java.lang.Exception
        Converts WHERE component to intermediate representation.
        Parameters:
        idAndValue - The id and property are contained within idAndValue[0]. The value is within idAndValue[1].
        matchC - MatchClause of the Cypher input.
        op - Logical operator of the where component.
        not - If the NOT keyword is used in this component, this flag is set to true.
        cW - CypWhere object.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - The id does not match any nodes/relationships.

      • addToJSONObject

        private static com.google.gson.JsonObject addToJSONObject(com.google.gson.JsonObject origProps,
                                                          java.lang.String prop,
                                                          java.lang.String value,
                                                          java.lang.String op,
                                                          boolean not,
                                                          CypWhere cW)
        Adds WHERE component to the properties of either the node or relationship the WHERE component was referring to. The new JSONObject is then returned from this method.
        Parameters:
        origProps - The original properties of the node/relationship.
        prop - The property to modify.
        value - The value to add.
        op - The type of logical operator involved.
        not - If the NOT keyword was used then this is true, otherwise false.
        cW - CypWhere object.
        Returns:
        The modified properties of the node/relationship.

      • invertOp

        private static java.lang.String invertOp(java.lang.String op)
        Inverts the operator in cases of NOT being used. = --> <> <= --> >= exists --> not exists
        Parameters:
        op - Original operator.
        Returns:
        String of the inverted operator.
